intro: Cremanthodium nobile var. yanyuanense, commonly known as the Yanyuan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
